properties.name: Allumiere - La Fontanaccia (settlement)
properties.c_notes:
The site yielded the remains of a substantial terraced villa from the Roman period, probably abandoned in the early 2nd century AD. All the archaeobotanical remains come from a modest rural house built among the villa’s rubble and dating to the 5th century AD. 
It is unfortunately impossible to determine the precise location of the individual contexts ‘Because [...] the archaeobotanical material, all preserved by charring, was recovered from the hut floor without using a grid system.
properties.bibliography: Sadori, L.,_Susanna, F._2005_Hints of economic change during the late Roman Empire period in central Italy: a study of charred plant remains from “La Fontanaccia”, near Rome_Vegetation History and Archaeobotany, 14_386-393
properties.parent_chronology_iccd: Medioevo ; Periodo Imperiale (Roma) ; Periodo Repubblicano (Roma) ; Tarda Antichità
